intro: Cyathocoma nigrovaginata, commonly known as the black-vaginal cyathocoma, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, tubular flowers that are typically dark purple or black in color. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its unique floral structure makes it an interesting subject for botanical study and horticultural interest.
